body:
I'm happy to see it reusable outside of Rails. I think it's a fair argument whether we really need a separate gem for it, or if it could live in ActiveSupport, but since the separate gem has already been made…

Gem would have to be moved to rails/ GH space, though.

On Sep 10, 2013, at 2:06 PM, Benjamin Fleischer <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Thanks for your thoughts @josevalim. My thoughts about the benefits of extracting it as a gem are also above, but basically
> 
> 	• There is a demonstrated desire for the gem as evidenced by forks of it popping up periodically
> 	• Statistics code really doesn't need to be tied to the Rails release cycle
> 	• Statistics LOC / code profiling aren't really a fundamental part of the Rails stack.
> 	• It's a common pattern for Rails to spawn dependent gems that don't themselves require Rails, or that aren't a fundamental part of the stack.
> 	• The code would be much better maintained on its own. There's been some code rot around this functionality.
> @dhh actually commented above that he'd prefer to keep existing functionality intact (at least per my understanding).
> 
> related post on rubyonrails-core if that is helpful for discussion.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
